frontmatter.title: Serilog with Asp.Net Core 2.x
frontmatter.description: Node.js is an open-source, cross-platform JavaScript run-time environment for executing JavaScript code server-side. Historically, JavaScript was used primarily for client-side scripting, in which scripts written in JavaScript are embedded in a webpage’s HTML, to be run client-side by a JavaScript engine in the user’s web browser.

node.excerpt:
Documentation stored with source files shares the same permissions.
Documentation stored in a separate Git repository can use different
access controls. If Gerrit Code Review is being used, branch level
read permissions can be used to grant or restrict access to any
documentation branches.
